title-group.article-title: A BOUND FOR THE ERROR TERM IN THE BRENT-MCMILLAN ALGORITHM

abstract.p: The Brent-McMillan algorithm B3 (1980), when implemented with binary splitting, is the fastest known algorithm for high-precision computation of Euler's constant. However, no rigorous error bound for the algorithm has ever been published. We provide such a bound and justify the empirical observations of Brent and McMillan. We also give bounds on the error in the asymptotic expansions of functions related to the Bessel functions I₀(x) and K₀(x) for positive real x.
